Their feeding is subtle, for they sustain themselves on energy taken gently in the night, often leaving their hosts unaware of what has occurred. Unlike the Devourer, the Hollowhost does not seek to destroy. They prefer to linger and nourish themselves over time, moving from one dwelling to another like a passing shadow. They are known for their ability to vanish from sight, slipping silently through windows and doors, unseen but ever present. Their substance glimmers with soft colors of pale pink, white, and gray, a palette that mirrors the light of dusk and dawn. Hollowhosts are regarded with both fear and awe, for they appear as caring companions even as they feed in secret.
feature_effect: As an Off-Action, you may touch a creature to siphon their essence without making a check, dealing [[1d4]] Psychic damage and healing for half the amount dealt. If the target is unaware of your presence, the damage is doubled. Make a Stealth check to remain undetected after the drain.

name: Predatory
description: These shifters possess a strong predatory heritage and are characterized by their sharp claws and powerful jaws. They are skilled hunters, often preying on meat to sustain themselves. Rarely found in cities, they prefer a tribal lifestyle where they can hunt and roam freely. Fierce and powerful, they are often seen as protectors of their tribe.
feature_effect: Once per day as an Off-Action, shift for 1 minute. While shifted, your unarmed strikes deal an additional 4 damage.
fetDuration: 1 minute

name: avian
description: These half-men have evolved to possess avian characteristics, with the ability to shift into a full bird form. Agile and quick, they can fly and soar with the grace of a bird. Often found near communities of avian beastfolk, they are considered a mutation of the humanoid/lycanthrope. Known for their strong sense of community, they are highly intelligent and adaptable.
feature_effect: You take half fall damage. Once per day as an Off-Action, shift for 1 minute. While shifted, you gain a fly speed of 60ft
fetDuration: 1 minute

name: Velorin
description: These shifters possess a strong cervidae heritage, characterized by their deer or hooved animal form. Known for their speed and agility, they can outrun and outmaneuver threats with ease. Peaceful and gentle by nature, they are fiercely loyal to their tribe and become formidable when threatened. Often found in wooded areas, they are considered protectors of the forest.
feature_effect: Take a stance at the end of your turn that remains until the start of your next turn, or until activated. When a creature makes a melee Attack against you and misses, you can use an off-action to move up to half your movement without Provoke.
fetDuration: Until the start of your next turn

name: aquatic
description: These shifters possess a strong aquatic heritage, characterized by their ability to shift into a full aquatic form such as fish or marine mammals. Equipped with powerful fins, gills, and webbed extremities, they excel in underwater environments. With heightened senses underwater and the ability to communicate with aquatic creatures, they are considered protectors of the ocean and its inhabitants. Often found near coastal or aquatic communities, they are known for their peaceful and loyal nature.
feature_effect: You can breathe air and water, suffer no underwater based penalties, and have a swim speed equal to your movement speed.

name: satyr
description: The Satyrs are a mystical and mischievous breed of shifters, deeply tied to the feywild and the untamed forces of nature. Often mistaken for beastmen, Satyrs possess a unique blend of humanoid intelligence and feral instinct. With goat-like features such as cloven hooves, small horns, and nimble frames, their true essence lies in their connection to the fey.Natural performers and instigators, Satyrs thrive in chaos and revelry, wielding haunting melodies and captivating charm to influence others. Despite their playful demeanor, they are fiercely protective of their kin and the wilds they call home. Often found in ancient groves or hidden fey crossings, they act as guardians and emissaries of their enigmatic fey ancestry
feature_effect: As an Action, let out a haunting, melodic bleat and make a Influence check. On a success, it confuses and distracts opponents, giving them disadvantage on a check. Only works once on a creature.
fetDuration: Until the end of their next turn

name: centaur
description:
Centaurs are proud and noble shifters, blending the strength of their equine heritage with the sharp wit and determination of their humanoid form. Known as tireless hunters and warriors, they roam the expansive grasslands and plains they call home. Centaur society revolves around freedom and duty, with members acting as both protectors and providers for their community.
In a bitter conflict with the Hellborn Minotaurs over the Thundering Plains, Centaurs view this battle as a fight for the survival of their way of life. Agile and fast, they are unmatched in endurance and maneuverability, revered as guardians of the plains. Skilled artisans and storytellers, Centaurs preserve their rich history through oral tradition and symbolic art, drawing strength from their connection to nature and the open skies.
feature_effect: If you move at least 20 ft in a straight line before attacking, your target must succeed on an Agility check or take [[1d4]] Impact damage and be knocked Prone.
fetDuration: Until the end of their next turn

name: Scorpikin
description:
Scorpikin, or Aqrabuamelu, are desert-born folk whose upper bodies resemble muscular humans while their lower halves form the armored bulk of a massive scorpion. Their chitin ranges from red to obsidian black, often patterned by the sands they dwell in. They carry a pair of large pincers as well as dexterous hands, making them both dangerous warriors and capable artisans.
Males tend to be leaner with sharper pincers and faster reflexes, while females are broader and heavier, with thicker carapaces and stronger tails. This dimorphism has shaped their culture, with males often serving as scouts or duelists and females taking on roles as defenders or leaders.
feature_effect: You have an extra pair of pincer arms and a stinger tail. Your pincers can hold simple objects. As an action you can make Strength or Agility attacks with your pincers or tail, dealing [[1d4]] piercing damage with the pincers or [[1d4]] Toxic damage with the tail.

name: Spiderkin
description:
Spiderkin are humanoids with long, angular limbs, thickly haired bodies, and prominent mandibles that click when they speak. Their eyes gleam in clusters of four or six, giving them excellent night vision. Their skin ranges from pale to dark mottled hues, often mirroring the patterns of woodland or cavern spiders.
Females grow larger and more robust, standing nearly a head taller than the average human, while males are slighter and more agile. Females are prized as warriors and providers, and males are often scholars or spellcasters. Both sexes weave silk, but females produce stronger strands suited for construction while males create finer thread for detail and art.
feature_effect: You can climb on walls and ceilings without checks. As an Action, you may spray webbing in a 20 ft square or line, creating difficult terrain for 1 minute.
fetDuration: 1 minute

name: Tikkin
description:
Tikkin are small, slight humanoids rarely taller than four feet, with pale or dusky skin, sharp fangs, and bright eyes that seem to glow faintly in low light. Their voices are soft and quick, with a cadence that hints at constant caution. Though frail in stature, they move with a sudden speed when threatened, and their senses are tuned to heartbeats and warmth.
Males are typically more wiry and fast, with angular faces and longer fingers adapted for delicate work, while females are rounder, stockier, and more resilient, often serving as anchors for their communities. This distinction is subtle compared to other species but is deeply noted among the Tikkin themselves.
feature_effect: You need to feed on blood, draining 1 pint in 1 minute from a living creature. After drinking, you heal [[1d6]], gain +10 armor and gain +1 to all checks for 1 hour. If you drink more than 1 pint from a creature, they gain the Exhausted condition for 1 hour.
fetDuration: 1 minute

name: Corvus
description: Corvus are a unique avian subspecies born under the patronage of the gods Huginn and Muninn. Those born under Huginn are intelligent crows, while those under Muninn are ravens cursed by a fey deity with perfect memory, though they can only speak in mimicry if they choose to. This duality of intelligence and memory has led them to thrive in roles as court reporters, spies, and stage performers. Often found in cities, Corvus use their talents to gather information, navigate social hierarchies, and make a living. Skilled in Stealth and adept at moving in the dark, they are both enigmatic and resourceful.
feature_effect: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. In dim light or darkness, you gain advantage on Stealth checks. You can also mimic simple sounds or voices you've heard; creatures may make an Intellect check to discern the mimicry.

name: Crane
description: The Crane are a proud and adventurous species, known for their long, slender limbs and formidable fighting skills. They are a nomadic people, constantly wandering in search of new experiences and challenges. Despite their wanderlust, they are fiercely loyal to their families and communities. Their society is organized around small, tight-knit clan groups, each led by a respected elder. These clans periodically gather for grand celebrations to share stories, trade goods, and honor their shared heritage. Cranes are trained in combat from a young age, using their long limbs to strike from unexpected angles and maintain a safe distance from their foes.
feature_effect: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Once per day, as an action, let out a resonant cry that heals allies within Short range for [[1d4]] and gives them +2 to their next check. Enemies in range must make a Spirit check or take the Deaf condition until the end of their next turn.
fetDuration: Until the end of their next turn

name: Hawk
description: The Hawk humanoids, also known as Avian Knights, are a proud and honorable species. Their bodies are covered in feathers, with wings that allow short flights or gliding over long distances. Their sharp talons, combined with their strength and agility, make them exceptional hunters and warriors. Hawks are organized in a feudal system, where each territory has its own lord responsible for the safety and well-being of their people.The Avian Knights, as the most powerful members of their society, serve as the lord’s personal protectors and military leaders. Known for their bravery, loyalty, and commitment to justice, they dedicate their lives to training and discipline to become the best warriors. Fiercely independent but compassionate, Hawks symbolize hope and are revered as defenders of the weak. Whether in the air or on the ground, they are a force to be reckoned with, embodying the virtues of strength, courage, and nobility.
feature_effect: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. Your talons are considered a Standard Weapon (Agi or Str; 1 hand, Light; 1d6 Slashing). On a success+ Attack roll, you may choose to grapple instead of rolling on the success table.

name: Passerine
description: The Passerine humanoids, also known as Swift Avians, are small but mighty birds known for their quickness, agility, and bright, colorful feathers. Their small size allows them to maneuver through tight spaces, dense forests, and crowded cities with ease. Adventurous and social, Passerines love exploring new places and meeting new people, making them natural messengers and scouts.Passerines are known for their sharp memory, able to recall intricate details from their travels. Their communication style includes a complex system of chirps, songs, and body language, making their interactions lively and expressive. Their ability to manipulate air currents with their wings enables them to glide effortlessly, navigate dangerous terrains, and find shortcuts, making them invaluable members of any traveling party.
feature_effect: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if carrying no Hefty items. As an action, if flying or at higher elevation, dive to strike a large or smaller target. The Attack deals [[1d6]] Impact damage and knocks the target Prone if they fail a Strength check.

name: Owl
description:
The Owl humanoids are a highly respected and influential species, characterized by their large, wise-looking eyes, muted feathers, and sharp talons for hunting. Known for their exceptional intelligence and problem-solving abilities, they are often called upon to serve as mediators, judges, and jurors due to their reputation for impartiality. Owls are also revered as sages and leaders, frequently consulted for their knowledge and insight.
Owl society places wisdom above all else, encouraging individuals to seek knowledge and experiences throughout their lives. They maintain a strong oral tradition, passing down stories of their wise ancestors from generation to generation. Ignorance is seen as a grave threat, and wisdom is viewed as the key to understanding the world. Owl humanoids are natural leaders, trusted decision-makers, and symbols of intellectual achievement within their communities.
feature_effect: You have a fly speed equal to your movement if unburdened. You have advantage on Observation checks related to sight, and you can see objects up to twice as far as most creatures in clear conditions.

name: Penguin
description: Penguins are a unique subspecies of avian beastmen, adapted to life in cold coastal regions and the open ocean. Though flightless, they are exceptional swimmers and agile divers, capable of navigating icy waters with unmatched grace. Known for their tightly-knit communities, they build intricate ice villages along glacial coasts, fortified against the harsh elements. Penguins hold deep cultural reverence for the "Eternal Ice," an ancient tradition celebrating resilience, teamwork, and the bond between the sea and the sky. These ceremonies involve synchronized dances and storytelling by elder penguins, recounting legendary migrations and ocean spirits.Penguins have strong protective instincts, working cooperatively to guard their homes from predators and environmental dangers. Their natural resilience and physical adaptations make them excellent aquatic scouts, fierce protectors, and invaluable allies in both the sea and icy terrains. Despite their smaller stature and inability to fly, penguins exemplify determination, resourcefulness, and a profound connection to the ocean's mysteries.
feature_effect: You have a swim speed equal to your movement. You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour and gain advantage on Survival checks in cold environments or near water.
fetDuration: 1 hour

name: Phoenix
description: Phoenixes are rare, mystical avians connected to fire and renewal. Known for their blazing feathers and the ability to rise from their ashes, they are symbols of hope and perseverance. Phoenix societies focus on the cycles of life, Death, and rebirth, with sacred pyres serving as places of renewal and meditation. Their fiery presence and ability to endure make them a beacon of resilience and inspiration.
feature_effect: You are immune to fire damage and deal an additional 1 fire damage on melee attacks and spells. If you take the Death condition, you instead burn to ash and return to life after 1d4 weeks. This ability cannot occur more than once per year.

name: Gorilla
description: The Gorilla subspecies is a powerful and intimidating force to be reckoned with. Renowned for their immense strength and warrior-like abilities, they are highly sought after in the corporate world. Many major companies employ Gorillas as bouncers and security guards, appreciating their physical prowess, discipline, intelligence, and loyalty. Their presence alone is often enough to deter troublemakers, making them an invaluable asset for businesses seeking top-notch security. Gorillas are not only symbols of power but also of trust and reliability.
feature_effect: You have advantage on Strength checks

name: Mono Grito
description: The Mono Grito subspecies, also known as the Howler Monkey subspecies, is known for their loud and piercing screams. Boisterous and outgoing, they thrive in group settings and enjoy being the center of attention. Their highly social nature makes them excellent communicators, and their ability to coordinate as a team is unmatched. Mono Gritos bring an infectious energy and excitement to any environment, making them a lively and colorful addition to any group.
feature_effect: As an Off-Action and scream at a creature in reach range, make an Influence check. On a success, give them disadvantage on their next check. This feature can only be used once per creature.

name: Oraggian
description: Oraggians are towering, contemplative beings who dwell in the high canopies and mist-laden valleys of the Prime and Fey realms. With russet fur and deep amber eyes that gleam with timeless understanding, they move with a deliberate grace that reflects immense patience. Each Oraggian is a living archive of stories, serving as teacher, philosopher, and guide who believes wisdom is not taught but uncovered through dialogue and reflection. Their homes, called Sanctums of Branch and Bark, are living monasteries woven from vines and ancient trees where apprentices study the balance of nature and thought. They often travel to mentor younger species or to restore harmony where arrogance has taken root. When they speak their words carry the calm authority of experience, and when they act it is with quiet purpose and control.
feature_effect: When you give the help action, add your Spirit to the assisted check.

name: Papio
description: Papio are wiry, quick-moving primates with keen eyes and brightly colored faces marked in reds, blues, and yellows. Their fur ranges from sandy brown to charcoal gray, and their limbs are long and powerful, built for climbing, sprinting, and wrestling. Their teeth are prominent and their grins wide, giving them an ever-playful look that often hides sharp awareness. Papio live loud and fast, thriving in groups that value courage, humor, and quick thinking. They adorn themselves with scraps of cloth, bone charms, and trinkets scavenged from their travels. Many become field medics, couriers, or survivalists, using wit and reflex over brute strength. When danger strikes, they move together in perfect rhythm, chattering to one another as they fight, patch wounds, or pull each other to safety. Beneath their wild energy lies an unshakable instinct to protect their troop.
feature_effect: As an action make an Influence (Intimidation) check against a humanoid creature no larger than twice your height. On a success, the target gains the Fear condition.

name: Lupine (Alpha)
description:
The Lupine (Alpha) subspecies are proud and fiercely loyal leaders, easily recognized by their striking coats of pure white or jet black. These colors are said to mark their lineage as direct descendants of Fenris, and many Alphas believe the wild spirit of that ancient beast still burns within them. Their heritage is tied to old sagas of bravery and ferocity, and they carry that weight with pride.
Alphas are natural-born leaders, often rising as pack heads, tribal chiefs, or war commanders. Their fiery temperaments can drive them to brash decisions, yet their determination and unwavering loyalty inspire those who follow them. In the wild, they are exceptional hunters, guided by sharp senses that allow them to track prey and enemies with ease.
Their howls echo across valleys and forests, resonant and commanding, rallying allies while filling enemies with dread. Though quick to anger, Alphas feel a profound responsibility for their pack’s survival. Many will place themselves in harm’s way rather than see their kin fall, embodying both the immense strength and the volatile flaws of their legendary ancestor.
feature_effect: Once per day, as an action, you can unleash a thunderous howl, the effects of which lasts for 1 minute. While active, allies within Short range have advantage on their melee attack checks and on Survival checks. At the start of the effect, choose one enemy within range. That creature must succeed on a Spirit check or take the Fear condition.
fetDuration: 1 minute

name: Lupine (Sovereign)
description: Lupine (Sovereign) Caniforms are regal and wise, embodying the harmonious balance between nature and their wolfen heritage. These noble figures serve as spiritual leaders and mediators, guiding their packs with a deep connection to the land and divine forces. Revering Tala, the goddess of nature, they dedicate their lives to expanding her influence and nurturing the wilds. Sovereign territories are lush havens, cultivated through their abilities to summon rain and nurture fertile soil, ensuring abundance for their kin. Known as the “Goodest Guardians,” Sovereigns prioritize justice and stewardship, resolving conflicts with diplomacy before resorting to strength. Their howls carry a sacred resonance, invoking blessings from the forest itself.
feature_effect: As an action, let out a resonant howl that invokes nature’s blessing. Summon rain, breeze or other effect that gives one creature either +2 or -2 on their next check

name: Ursakin
description: The Ursakin are a gentle yet powerful subspecies, embodying the strength and resilience of their bear ancestors. Known for their love of community and simple pleasures, Ursakin villages are nestled in forest clearings or by rivers, where they live in harmony with nature. They are natural builders and protectors, revered for their ability to perform great feats of strength and their calm, thoughtful demeanor. However, when provoked or their kin are threatened, Ursakin become unyielding warriors, using their size and power to defend their homes. Tales often recount heroic Ursakin warriors holding off hordes of enemies or performing impossible feats of endurance. Despite their intimidating presence, Ursakin are kind-hearted and value friendship, often bonding with others over food, stories, and a shared love of nature.
feature_effect: Once per day, as an off-action, negate any amount of damage. However, you take the Exhausted condition.
fetDuration: Until the end of their next turn

name: Foxxin
description: The Foxxin are clever and quick-witted, known for their playful nature and boundless adaptability. Found in bustling cities, dense forests, or barren deserts, the Foxxin thrive wherever they roam, blending intelligence with resourcefulness to survive. Often seen as tricksters, they use their sharp minds and natural charm to outmaneuver foes, negotiate favorable deals, or escape sticky situations.Foxxin society celebrates legendary rogues and cunning heroes, admired for outsmarting stronger opponents. Despite their sly reputation, they possess an innate sense of justice, often working in the shadows to protect the vulnerable. Their laughter-like calls are both a signature and a weapon, unnerving enemies and rallying allies. Valuing wit, charm, and mischief, Foxxin make both entertaining companions and formidable opponents.
feature_effect: You only take 1 damage from stress when pushing on a check.

name: Coyote
description:
The nomadic Coyotes are the wandering storytellers and resilient survivalists of the Caniform species. Often traveling in small groups or as lone adventurers, they are known for their sharp tongues and clever antics. Coyotes thrive in open plains, deserts, and scrublands, where they use their humor and guile to outwit enemies and navigate social conflicts.
Believing in the power of stories to inspire and unite, Coyotes often serve as the historians of their people. Their ability to adapt to harsh conditions makes them skilled scavengers and cunning strategists. While their antics can be chaotic, they are also deeply tied to their trickster roots, bringing laughter and mischief wherever they go. Their Howling Laughter, a mocking and disruptive call, echoes through the wilds, confusing foes and leaving them vulnerable.
feature_effect: As an action, let out a mocking howl, causing enemies within Short range to make an Intellect check or take the Confused condition until the end of their next turn.

name: Caprakin
description: The Caprakin are hardy and tenacious humanoid beastmen, thriving in steep, rocky landscapes where their agility and balance are unparalleled. Known for their bold nature and fierce independence, they are often found in mountainous regions, grazing on natural grasses and defending their tight-knit communities with vigor. Despite their aloof demeanor, Caprakin hold strong loyalty to their herds and ancestral lands.Legends of the Caprakin tell of their defiance against invaders, using their mountainous homes as natural fortresses to repel stronger foes. Their haunting war cries echo through the cliffs, instilling Fear and awe in those who hear them. Caprakin culture values resilience, storytelling, and a deep connection to the land. Climbing competitions and feats of strength are common rituals, often accompanied by epic tales of their heroes.
feature_effect: Once per day, as an action, unleash a chilling warcry to all creatures within short range. You and your allies cannot be knocked Prone and ignore rocky terrain. Enemies must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition until the end of their next turn.
fetDuration: Until the end of their next turn

name: Hellhorn
description: The Hellhorn Minotaurs are a fiery and fearsome subspecies, their blood-red fur and sharp horns reflecting their infernal ancestry. Touched by dark, otherworldly forces, Hellhorns are known for their quick tempers and relentless ferocity in battle. Born on windswept plains, they embrace the thrill of the hunt, pursuing wild game and rival tribes with unmatched determination. While their infernal heritage often casts them in a sinister light, many Hellhorns channel their rage toward protecting their kin or carving out territories to ensure survival.Hellhorn culture values strength and dominance, with ceremonial duels and displays of power marking their gatherings. Some Hellhorns seek redemption, striving to break free from their dark heritage, while others fully embrace it, using their infernal resilience to dominate enemies and defend their lands.
feature_effect: Your horns are natural weapons (Str or Agi; Light; 1d4 Physical, Piercing). If you move at least 20 ft toward a target before attacking, you have advantage on your next melee Attack. On a success+, you may choose to pin the target instead of rolling on the success table.

name: Minotaur
description: The Labyrinthine Minotaurs are ancient guardians, revered for their unparalleled sense of direction and role as protectors of sacred mazes. Their fur often bears intricate, natural patterns resembling mazes, and their towering frames exude both mystery and wisdom. Originating as wardens of ancient dungeons, they are now invaluable guides in modern cities, where their ability to never lose their way makes them adept navigators and troubleshooters in crowded environments.Labyrinthine Minotaur culture is steeped in traditions of service and protection, with rites of passage that involve defending or solving labyrinths. To these Minotaurs, mazes are sacred spaces connecting them to their ancestors and their duty. Despite their intimidating presence, Labyrinthine Minotaurs are gentle and patient, earning respect as guides, mediators, and wise protectors.
feature_effect: Your horns are natural weapons (Str or Agi; Light; 1d4 Physical, Piercing). You are never lost in a location you have visited before. As an action, you can create illusory walls that match the surrounding area. These walls last for 1 minute and can be used to mislead or redirect creatures in mazes or corridors.
fetDuration: 1 minute

name: Cervidae
description: Cervidae are elegant and swift Cloven beastmen, known for their connection to the forest and their strong sense of community. With antlers that grow in intricate patterns, they serve as protectors of ancient groves and champions of nature. While they are wise and peaceful, they can become fierce defenders when their homes are threatened.
feature_effect: You ignore movement penalties from natural terrain such as foliage, mud, or undergrowth. Once per round, when a melee Attack against you misses, you may move up to half your speed without Provoking.

name: Equinor
description: Equinor are proud and noble Cloven who embody the spirit of freedom and the open plains. With sleek builds and powerful legs, they are unmatched in endurance and speed, capable of covering great distances without tiring. Their culture revolves around their connection to the land and the stars, often using celestial patterns to chart their travels. Known for their loyalty and unyielding determination, Equinor serve as scouts, messengers, and protectors, weaving tales of their journeys into the fabric of their communities.
feature_effect: When you take the Dash action, you move triple your normal speed, and you gain advantage on Survival checks related to long-distance travel or navigation.

name: Bovinus
description: The Bovinus are massive, bull-like Cloven, known for their unwavering strength and communal bonds. With their thick hides and powerful horns, they are natural defenders of their herds and lands. Bovinus are deeply spiritual, often holding rituals that honor the cycles of nature and their ancestors. Their culture values cooperation and hard work, with communal feasts and storytelling as central aspects of their society. Despite their gentle and calm demeanor, Bovinus are formidable in battle, capable of charging enemies with devastating force.
feature_effect: You gain +5 armor that can be healed or repaired. If you move at least 20 ft toward a target before attacking, you have advantage on the melee Attack. On a success+, you may choose to knock the target Prone instead of rolling on the success table.

name: Paka Short Hair
description: Short-haired Paka dominate the coasts, sleek and agile, their coats adapted for the spray and salt of maritime life. Known as bold sailors and daring explorers, they prize adaptability and quick thinking. Their communities are often bustling ports, full of song, laughter, and the clamor of trade. Short-hairs tend to leap headlong into opportunity, making them excellent navigators, pilots, and adventurers.
feature_effect: Gain +1 Agility. Gain advantage on any checks related to navigation, riding, or piloting.

name: Paka Long Hair
description: Long-haired Paka descend from the aristocrats of lost kingdoms. Their flowing coats, often kept immaculately groomed, are symbols of endurance and legacy. They are artisans and chroniclers, preferring diplomacy, craftsmanship, and history over direct confrontation. Many live inland or in fortified coastal enclaves, safeguarding heirlooms, records, and stories of Paka greatness. Though they have lost empires, long-hairs carry themselves with dignity, serving as cultural anchors for their people.
feature_effect: Gain +1 to Influence. Gain advantage on Influence (Bartering) checks when trading goods or services.

name: Shujaa Sun Mane
description: Sun-Manes are the most common among the pride, with manes of gold, tawny, or flame-red. They embody leadership, charisma, and martial might, often rising as chiefs, generals, or champions. Sun-Manes are celebrated in song and story as living embodiments of courage and honor, rallying others with their sheer presence. Their culture revolves around glory in combat and respect in unity, making them both inspiring leaders and steadfast protectors.
feature_effect: As a half-action, give a simple command to an ally within short range. The ally moves their turn in initiative order to immediately after yours.

name: Shujaa Ash Mane
description: Ash-Manes are rare and revered, born with pale or darkened manes said to carry omens of destiny. Legends claim their appearance is tied to celestial events or divine trials, marking them as chosen guardians of forgotten knowledge. Unlike their Sun-Mane kin, Ash-Manes are quiet and contemplative, often serving as mystics, lorekeepers, or watchers over sacred places. Their roars are said to echo with the weight of the ancestors, chilling foes and rallying allies. To encounter an Ash-Mane is to glimpse the wisdom of ages wrapped in the form of a warrior.
feature_effect: As a Off-Action, when an ally within melee range is targeted by an Attack, you can reduce the attacker's roll by -3.

name: Kivuli (Panthari)
description: The Kivuli, or Panthari, are enigmatic and elusive Felidae, often called the "Shadows of the Jungle." Living in dense forests or hidden enclaves, they are masters of Stealth and ambush tactics. Their black or darkly patterned fur allows them to blend seamlessly with their surroundings, making them nearly invisible in low light. Kivuli culture revolves around safeguarding ancient knowledge and defending sacred jungle sites. While they prefer to remain unseen, their swift and precise strikes leave an unforgettable mark on those who threaten their home.Their society values cunning over brute strength, with elders teaching younger generations the art of patience, observation, and precision. Kivuli legends speak of "Night Stalkers," legendary warriors who once protected entire regions with unmatched Stealth and agility.
feature_effect: Gain advantage on Stealth checks in natural environments. On a success+ Stealth check, you gain the Invisible condition until the end of your next turn.
fetDuration: Until the end of their next turn

name: Cheetari (Mwendokasi)
description: The Mwendokasi, or Cheetari, are the fastest of all Felidae, known for their unmatched speed and agility. Found in open savannahs or expansive grasslands, their slim, muscular builds allow them to outrun nearly any creature. Mwendokasi are revered as messengers, scouts, and first responders in times of conflict, carrying vital information across vast distances.Their culture celebrates swiftness as both a survival tool and a spiritual connection to the wind. Ritual foot races and endurance trials are key traditions, showcasing their speed as an offering to the spirits of the plains. Legends tell of Nyayo za Upepo (Steps of the Wind), Mwendokasi who could run so fast they seemed to disappear entirely, leaving only a trail of wind behind them.
feature_effect: As an off-action, double your movement speed until the end of this turn.

name: Hippokin
description: The Hippokin are contemplative and wise, resembling humanoid hippopotamuses. Known for their love of rivers and marshlands, they are natural swimmers and builders, often constructing homes along waterways. Hippokin are revered for their intellect and ingenuity, focusing on crafting, invention, and the exchange of ideas. Their communities serve as hubs for trade and knowledge, enriching their regions with innovation.Hippokin take pride in their calm and measured demeanor, often acting as mediators and problem-solvers. However, when roused to action, their immense strength and nearly impenetrable hide make them formidable opponents. Hippokin warriors are known for using water as a tactical advantage, drawing enemies into terrain they control
feature_effect: Gain an additional +5 armor that can be healed or repaired. While submerged in water, you have advantage on Physical checks and can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.
fetDuration: 1 hour

name: Elephantine
description: The Elephantine are gentle giants, deeply rooted in tradition and community. Resembling humanoid elephants, they are renowned for their exceptional memories, which they use to preserve history, culture, and craftsmanship. Elephantine communities are often led by matriarchs or councils of elders, guiding their people with wisdom and compassion.Deeply connected to the land, the Elephantine act as stewards of the environment and protectors of sacred sites. Their trunk, a versatile and powerful appendage, symbolizes their adaptability and strength. Elephantine artisans are famed for creating tools, art, and architecture that blend functionality with beauty.
feature_effect: Gain an additional +5 armor that can be healed or repaired. Your trunk functions as both tool and weapon. You can interact with objects, grapple creatures, or make an off-action unarmed Attack that deals [[1d4]] Impact damage.

name: Roxodon
description: The Roxodon are stoic and formidable, resembling humanoid rhinoceroses. Known for their incredible strength and resilience, they are natural protectors, often serving as guardians of their communities and territories. With rough, armor-like skin and massive horns, they are nearly impervious to physical harm, and their sheer presence can deter most threats.Roxodon society values endurance and discipline, emphasizing physical training and martial skill. Their culture is one of balance: fierce in defense of their kin but equally compassionate and generous. Roxodon warriors are celebrated for charging into battle, using their horns to scatter enemies and break through defenses.
feature_effect: Gain an additional +10 armor that can be healed or repaired If you move at least 20 ft toward a target before attacking, you have advantage on your next melee Attack.

name: Camelon
description: The Camelon are Half Cloven adapted to arid environments, with features resembling humanoid camels. Known for their resilience and resourcefulness, they endure extreme conditions and traverse vast deserts with ease. Camelon culture revolves around water conservation, trade, and nomadic traditions, often serving as guides and merchants in harsh terrains.
feature_effect: You require only half the normal amount of food and water to survive. Once per Long Rest, you may ignore one instance of elemental damage.

name: Leporidae
description: The Leporidae have a dark past. For a long time, both the Leporidae and halflings were hunted due to a rumor that the feet of these creatures provided a luck bonus. This history shifted the nature of the Leporidae, and they now stick to the underground as much as possible. Despite this, Leporidae remain humble and happy travelers, seeking friendship and love wherever they go.
feature_effect: Once per day, when you fail a check, you can reroll it and take the new result.

name: Oposhka
description:
Opossums are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid opossums. Known for their love of shiny objects and their ability to hang from trees with their prehensile tails, they often become merchants or collectors of unusual and valuable items.
Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Opossums have slender, flexible bodies covered in grayish-white fur, long rat-like tails for climbing and hanging, pointed snouts, small ears, and beady eyes. They build their homes in trees or burrows, and their communities are often found in forested areas. Fascinated by shiny and unusual objects, Opossums trade and collect items with other races, leveraging their cunning and resourcefulness.
feature_effect: Your prehensile tail is a natural weapon (Agi or Str; Light; 1d6 Impact). On a success+, you may knock the target Prone instead of rolling on the success table.

name: Rakkari
description: Raccoons are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid raccoons. They are inventive and intelligent creatures, often creating gadgets and trinkets or collaborating with other races to design and build traps.Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Raccoons have stocky bodies covered in grayish-brown fur with distinctive black markings around their eyes. They have dexterous, human-like hands with sharp claws, bushy ringed tails, pointed snouts, small ears, and dark eyes. Known for their creativity and ingenuity, Raccoon communities focus on crafting and problem-solving, often working together to invent useful devices. Sociable and curious, they bond easily with others who share their passion for discovery and invention.
feature_effect: Once per day, create a simple gadget or trap from found materials. You also gain advantage on Crafting checks to pick locks or disable traps.

name: Sciurian
description: Squirrels are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid squirrels. Energetic and agile, they have a strong desire to explore and travel, although their attachment to food hoards often keeps them close to home.Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Squirrels have slender bodies covered in reddish-brown fur, large bushy tails, sharp claws for climbing, round expressive eyes, and small tufted ears. Their communities are usually found in forested areas, with homes built in trees or burrows. Adventurous and curious, they protect their food hoards fiercely and form close bonds with those who share their love of exploration and adventure.
feature_effect: In dim light or darkness, you gain advantage on Agility or Stealth checks made to steal or hide objects. Once per Long Rest, you can instantly palm or conceal a small item without a check.

name: Damreth
description: Beavers are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid beavers. They are hardworking and industrious creatures, renowned for their skill in construction and engineering.Standing between 4-5 ft tall, Beavers have stocky bodies covered in thick, waterproof fur in shades of brown. They are easily identified by their large, flat tails and powerful front teeth capable of cutting through wood with ease. Beavers also have small, rounded ears and dark eyes.Beaver communities are often found near rivers and lakes, where they construct elaborate dams and lodges using their natural engineering talents. Highly organized and efficient, they work together to build impressive structures that provide safety and comfort for their families. Beavers have a strong sense of community and cooperation, often working alongside other races on large-scale construction projects.
feature_effect: You deal double damage to structures and can make a bite attack as an off-action, dealing [[1d4]] Piercing damage.

name: Ornithian
description: Platypuses are a subspecies of Gliers resembling humanoid platypuses. They are enigmatic and peculiar creatures, possessing a unique set of abilities that set them apart from other Gliers.Standing between 3-4 ft tall, Platypuses have streamlined bodies covered in waterproof fur in shades of brown. Their flat, duck-like bills and webbed feet make them excellent swimmers, while their small, rounded ears and dark eyes give them a curious and alert appearance.Platypus communities are typically found near rivers and lakes, where they build their homes in burrows along the banks. Solitary and mysterious, they rarely interact with other races. Platypuses have a strong connection to the natural world, using their electrolocation abilities to navigate aquatic environments and find food. Resourceful and adaptable, they thrive in a variety of situations.
feature_effect: You can make an unarmed strike against flesh that deals an additional [[1d4]] Toxic damage. You gain advantage on balance checks while swimming or climbing.

name: Quillkin
description: The Quillkin are defensive specialists, resembling humanoid porcupines. Covered in sharp quills, they are tough and resilient, known for their ability to ward off predators with their natural defenses.Solitary and cautious, Quillkin prefer to avoid conflict but are formidable opponents when cornered. Their sharp quills make them highly effective at deterring attackers and ensuring their survival in the wild.
feature_effect: When hit by a melee Attack, deal 1 Piercing damage back to the attacker.

name: Chippoterian
description: Chippoterian, also known as bat folk, are a diverse species known for their ability to fly. Though not avian, they possess traits of various bat species such as vampire bats, fruit bats, and even deformed-nosed varieties. Their wings and keen senses make them excellent rangers and spies. Highly adaptable, they can survive in most environments, particularly dark and damp areas. Known for their Stealth and dark vision, Chippoterian are fiercely loyal to their tribes and thrive in close-knit communities.
feature_effect: You have flight speed equal to movement unless you have more than 1 hefty item. As an Action emit a high pitched sound that allows you to sense all creatures within Medium range if they have a physical form.

name: Curlbane
description: The Pangolin are enigmatic and protective humanoids with scaled armor and retractable claws. Often acting as guardians of natural reserves, they are defenders of endangered ecosystems. Their ability to curl into a ball makes them nearly impervious to harm.Pangolin communities are highly secretive, living in remote, forested regions. Seen as keepers of ancient natural wisdom, their scales are often inscribed with symbols representing the cycles of life and nature.
feature_effect: As an off-action, curl into a ball to double your armor until the start of your next turn, but you gain the Constrained condition

name: Molefolk
description: Molefolk are subterranean Gliers with strong, clawed hands designed for digging. Thriving underground, they excavate vast tunnel systems for their homes and communities. Resourceful and resilient, Molefolk are perfectly adapted to life in dark and confined spaces.
feature_effect: You have a burrow speed equal to half your movement and are immune to the Blind condition.

name: Armadaran
description: Armadillo beastmen are sturdy and adaptable, with armored shells that provide natural protection. Known for their ability to curl into a ball and roll at high speeds, they often serve as scouts or messengers in challenging terrain.Armadillo communities are highly mobile, often traveling in caravans across deserts and grasslands. They value adaptability and resourcefulness, with a knack for finding creative solutions to problems.
feature_effect: As an action, curl into a ball and roll up to half your movement in a straight line, dealing [[1d6]] Impact damage to all creatures in your path. Targets must succeed on an Agility check or be knocked Prone. You also take the prone condition at the end of the action.

name: Savra (Lizard-Greek)
description: The Savra are a proud and resilient race of lizard-like humanoids. Their belief in their ancient origins gives them a sense of entitlement and nobility, regardless of their social standing. They often exhibit regal behavior and have an air of sophistication about them. Their scales come in a variety of colors and patterns, and their bodies are lean and muscular.The Savra are known for their remarkable ability to recover from conditions in half the time, making them formidable adversaries and reliable allies.
feature_effect: As an action, make a Survival check to remove a non-major condition.

name: Rua (Turtle-Vietnamese)
description: The wise and nomadic Rua are humanoid turtles that seek to protect those around them. Known for their great wisdom and courage, the Rua are exemplified by the legendary Hanoi, who stopped a war by taking a powerful magic sword from a tyrant. Rua have large, hard shells that provide them with natural protection, and they can use their shells as a "Shell of Holding" for storage or as additional armor that regenerates during a Long Rest. Seen as gentle protectors, Rua are fiercely loyal to their allies.
feature_effect: Your shell gives you +10 armor. Hold double the amount of bulk in your shell.

name: Crokagator
description: The Crokagator are a race of large, powerful lizardmen that inhabit swamps and lakes. They are the undisputed rulers of stagnant pools of water, fiercely defending their territory with tight-knit tribes. Known for their thick, muscular bodies covered in rough scales and their devastatingly powerful jaws, Crokagators are fearsome warriors and formidable defenders of their domain.Crokagators possess unique abilities that make them terrifying in combat. Their deep bellow can instill fear in their enemies, while their signature "deathroll" Attack delivers massive Impact damage to pinned foes. These traits, combined with their ferocious nature, make them both dangerous foes and invaluable allies in battle.
feature_effect: As an action, make a deep bellow. Enemies within reach must make a Mental check. On a failure, they take the Fear condition.

name: She-Ren (Constrictor)
description: The Constrictor She-Ren are heavy-bodied and muscular, often with serpentine lower halves adapted for crushing strength. Their society esteems warriors and guardians, and their coils are feared for their ability to crush the life out of prey.
feature_effect: You have advantage on Grappling checks. When you maintain a grapple, you may deal [[1d4]] Impact damage as an off-action.

name: She-Ren (Venomous)
description: The Venomous She-Ren are leaner and quicker, with pronounced fangs and ornate patterns across their scales. Their culture prizes cunning, stealth, and the careful strike, and their poison is both feared and revered.
feature_effect: As an action, make a bite Attack that deals [[1d4]] Piercing damage. On a flesh hit, deal an additional [[1d4]] Toxic damage.

name: Kangarans
description: Kangarans are powerful and agile humanoids, resembling kangaroos. Known for their incredible jumping abilities and strong legs, they thrive in open plains and arid landscapes. Kangarans are nomadic by nature, traveling in small groups and following seasonal changes to find resources. They are fiercely protective of their kin and are renowned for their prowess in combat, using their legs to deliver devastating kicks.Kangaran communities value independence and self-reliance but come together in times of need. They often engage in ritualized combat as a way of resolving disputes or determining leadership, a tradition deeply rooted in their warrior culture.
feature_effect: You can jump half your movement as part of a melee Attack, dealing an additional [[1d4]] Impact damage and knocking the target Prone if they fail a Strength check.

name: Wombarn
description: Wombarn are stout and determined humanoids resembling wombats. Known for their incredible digging abilities and sturdy frames, they are natural builders and defenders. Their burrow-like homes are marvels of engineering, designed to withstand predators and environmental hazards.Wombarn culture values hard work and practicality, with a focus on creating lasting structures and strong defenses. They are famously stubborn and can be immovable when their minds are set.
feature_effect: You have a burrowing speed of half your movement, allowing you to move through loose soil or soft dirt. Additionally, you can use an action to create difficult terrain in a reach-range area by digging.
